intro: Zornia diphylla subsp. cuyabensis, commonly known as the Cuyabén zornia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in the Andean regions of Peru and Bolivia. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple, arranged in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along riverbanks. Zornia diphylla subsp. cuyabensis is notable for its ecological role in supporting local insect populations and its potential use in traditional medicine.
